page.title: 16THE CHURCH-SUTTON ST JAMES
page.content: We have chosen the parish church as our central feature because it is very different to others, as the tower is separate from the main building. There are two theories as to why this is.One theory is that during the Civil War in the seventeenth century, there was a fire during the fighting. Another idea is that the church had fallen into disuse and somehow caught fire.Someone told us that the church and tower were built separately because the land was so wet and marshy.It is hard to know the real reason, but it is an attractive church, small and very light. The tower walls are almost a metre thick and is an excellent example of medieval construction. The church was built and maintained by the local people, but, as mentioned it is now in two parts.
